sentences.english: The first semi-autobiographical movie "Miracle Girl" will also be shot in China.
sentences.chinese: 第一部半自传式的电影“奇迹少女”也将在国内拍色。

sentences.english: However, only one European site, the Colosseum, was picked for the new seven wonders.
sentences.chinese: 然而，新7大奇迹只有古罗马斗兽场一个是在欧洲。

sentences.english: Miracles sometimes occur, but one has to work terribly for them. (C.Weizmann)
sentences.chinese: 奇迹有时候是会发生的，但是你得为之拼命的努力。

sentences.english: They are the unsung heroes of the Chinese economic miracle.
sentences.chinese: 他们是中国经济奇迹的无名英雄。

sentences.english: You wonder at the miracle of this awesome display of Nature.
sentences.chinese: 你对自然的这个令人敬畏的展示奇迹啧啧称奇。

sentences.english: The people of Linxian Country really did wonders in building the canal.
sentences.chinese: 林县人民修建这条水渠，的确创造了奇迹。

sentences.english: There were street clashes in Athens last week. Little wonder.
sentences.chinese: 上周雅典有街头冲突，小奇迹。

sentences.english: There is no order of difficulty in miracles.
Archangel Michael is the Angel of Miracles who strengthens the spirit during difficult times or dangerous situations.
sentences.chinese: 大天使麦可是在艰难或危险时刻强化心智的奇迹天使。

sentences.english: It's another manufactured marvel of silicon and plastic.
sentences.chinese: 它是另一个硅和塑料的工程奇迹。

sentences.english: The Tunisian economic miracle was an illusion, they claimed.
sentences.chinese: 他们宣称，突尼斯的经济奇迹只是一种幻象。

sentences.english: It's a wonder, really, the Queen didn't choke on her Cornflakes.
sentences.chinese: 这真是奇迹，女王在吃玉米片早餐时没有呛到。

sentences.english: We always suggest our Wonder-Full Balm for scuffs, cuts and little burns.
sentences.chinese: 我们总是建议使用奇迹修复霜用于刀伤烫伤。

sentences.english: Magdalene is about work — not miracles, not fairy tales.
sentences.chinese: 抹大拉从良所意味着工作，没有奇迹，没有童话故事。

sentences.english: You never know what that could lead to.
sentences.chinese: 你永远猜不着会有什么奇迹呢。

sentences.english: And it seemed that without a miracle, America's fight for freedom would be doomed.
sentences.chinese: 看起来不会有奇迹了，美国的为自由而战必将胜利。

definition: to create/to bring about/to produce/to set (a record)
legendary/fantasy saga/romance/short stories of the Tang and Song Dynasty
to rise from the dead (idiom); fig. an unexpected recovery
huge/great/grand/worthy of the greatest admiration/important (contribution etc)
